summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The indictment details Maxwell's role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of multiple minor victims between approximately 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor victims, with Maxwell assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to these victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice and transport minor girls across state lines for the purpose of sexual abuse. Maxwell was in an intimate relationship with Epstein and was paid to manage his properties.
Maxwell facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims by grooming them, normalizing sexual abuse, and being present during abuse.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor victims, including causing them to travel across state lines.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Interaction with Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence, providing an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging her to massage Epstein.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged interactions knowing Epstein would sexually abuse her.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition Perjury
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with anyone under 18 at Epstein's properties other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition Perjury
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified about her awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, her knowledge of Epstein's other sexual partners, and denied ever giving massages to anyone, including Epstein and Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and transport minor girls across state lines for sexual abuse between approximately 1994 and 1997.
The indictment identifies three minor victims (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) who were as young as 14 years old when groomed and abused, with abuse occurring in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.
Maxwell's methods included befriending victims, normalizing sexual conduct, being present during abuse, and encouraging victims to provide sexualized massages to Epstein.
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions, where she denied knowledge of Epstein's scheme and her own involvement.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein had an intimate relationship and she was paid to manage his properties during the period of the conspiracy.
